fields.label: Kanji
fields.description: The kanji character(s) representing the word or concept.

fields.label: Reading
fields.description: The pronunciation of the kanji in hiragana or katakana.

fields.label: Meaning
fields.description: The meaning or translation of the word or kanji.

fields.label: Example
fields.description: Optional example sentence(s). Expected shape: { ja: string, en: string, notes: [string] }
fields.notes: Use `ja` for the Japanese sentence, `en` for an English gloss/translation, and `notes` for short usage notes or tips.

fields.label: Orthography
fields.description: Indicates the script usually used to write the word. Helpful for words like 'いちご' (usually kana) or loanwords that are katakana-only.

values.kana: Primarily written in kana (平仮名 or 片仮名).
values.both: Both kanji and kana are commonly used (context-dependent).
values.either: Either script is acceptable; no strong preference.

fields.label: Type
fields.description: How to choose: use 'standalone-noun' when the kanji can appear as a standalone word without okurigana. Use 'verb-stem' for kanji forming part of a verb. Use 'compound-morpheme' for bound/on-yomi uses in compounds. Use 'sentence' or 'phrase' for multi-word units or full clauses. Other values cover adjectives, particles, counters, etc.

values.noun: A standalone noun not requiring okurigana.
values.standalone-noun: Kanji that can appear as a word by itself without okurigana.
values.compound-morpheme: Kanji that only appears in compounds (bound or on-yomi usage).
values.verb-stem: Kanji that appears as part of a verb stem requiring okurigana.
values.irregular-verb: Irregular verbs (する, 来る, etc.).
values.sentence: A full grammatical sentence, usually contains subject/object/verb.
values.phrase-sentence: A phrase that is a complete clause or predicate-object unit.

fields.label: Verb Type
fields.description: Classifies the structural type of lexical verbs only (single verbs, not sentences). Use only when `type` is a verb class.

values.simple: A standalone lexical verb (e.g., 飲む, 生きる).
values.compound: Compound verb formed from two verbs or stem+verb.
values.expression: Sentence-like phrase, not a lexical verb (rare usage; usually better classified as type='sentence').

fields.label: Compound Type
fields.description: Specifies the linguistic nature of a compound verb. Only applicable if `verbType` is 'compound'.

values.compositional: Derived by rule; meaning fully predictable from components.
values.lexical: Stored in the lexicon; meaning not derivable by rule.
values.aspectual: Encodes phase, completion, or continuation of the action.
values.grammaticalized: Second verb loses original lexical meaning, functions as a grammatical/auxiliary operator.

fields.label: Origin
fields.description: Etymological source of the word. Used for katakana entries where origin/language of borrowing is relevant.

values.English: Direct loan from English with mostly equivalent meaning.
values.English-derived: Loan from English with semantic narrowing or shift in Japanese.
values.Wasei-eigo: Japanese coinage built from English elements.
values.Japanese: Native Japanese word or internal formation.
values.Other: Loanword from another language not listed.
